title: Kleene's recursion theorem
summary: In computability theory,  Kleene's recursion theorems are a pair of fundamental results about the application of computable functions to their own descriptions.    The theorems were first proved by Stephen Kleene in 1938[1] and appear in his 1952 book Introduction to Metamathematics.[2] A related theorem, which constructs fixed points of a computable function, is known as Rogers's theorem and is due to Hartley Rogers, Jr.[3]
